body: I see in the logs a number of people trying to interact with @PoshChan, it's hardcoded currently to only respond to my commands :)
@SteveL-MSFT you can't keep _all_ the fun to yourself forever ðŸ˜‰

@vexx32 Don't worry, PoshChan is OSS, just not ready for public consumption yet.  It's built on PowerShell and Azure Functions.  What I'm trying to fix right now is getting it to successfully call the AzDevOps API to trigger a rebuild.
@SteveL-MSFT is it too late for `PwshChan`? ðŸ˜‚
I thought pwsh was what the powershell team was moving forward with. Wouldn't posh Chan be inconsistent with the desire to push PWSH moving forward? @SteveL-MSFT

`PoshChan` is the name the community has already given to the avatar character, so the name is just a play on that.  I believe we've said that `pwsh` is pronounced `posh`, so `PwshChan` would work as well.
ðŸ¤” I wasn't there for the pronunciation pronouncement, so I've been pronouncing it `push` ðŸ˜‚
Honestly I thought it was pronounced  p-wish so your not the only one ðŸ¤£ðŸ¤£ðŸ¤£

Closing this for now as I don't have time to continue working on this right now.  Plan is to get ability for maintainers to initiate a feature or package run without requesting the author to push a new commit.
